website_summaries.verdict: A chew-proof slow feeder bowl that presents a challenge to dogs while keeping them from wolfing down their food.
pros: Slows down dogs’ eating considerably, with users saying feeding time has risen from seconds to 5-10 minutes
Sturdy build, to put up with lots of pawing and gnawing
Rubber feet on the bottom help the bowl slide around less
cons: Some dogs are able to flip the bowl over, spilling the food
Small dogs and cats may have trouble reaching food deep in the grooves

customer_reviews.title: I hate, Hate, HATE this Bowl !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I hate, Hate, HATE this bowl !!!!!! I used to be able to wolf my dinner down in 20 seconds flat. BANG! and it was gone. So what I went to the vet once or twice for bloat - who cares! Ize like to eat, and Ize like to eat fast. Now with this 60's retro psychedelic shaped safety orange dish, I have to work to get every piece of kibble. It takes me 10 minutes now to eat a 20 second dinner. Its downright humiliating. The shame - oh, the shame! Hmmm. Come to think about it, I haven't been to the vet for a while. Phhhhhht. Just coincidence, I'm sure.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Mcphail

customer_reviews.title: Plastic is flaking off
customer_reviews.text: After less than 2 months the plastic coating of gloss has started to come off in flakes. I can't let my dog use it anymore because I don't want her eating plastic.
customer_reviews.author: matthew b

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my pitbulls
customer_reviews.text: I have two pitbulls, and one of them has been a food inhaler since he was a puppy. I got the spiral one last year and I decided to get another one to change it up a bit. He is still really fast eater but it has slowed him down from finishing a cup of food in less than a minute to about 3 minutes. I got the small size and it holds about 1.5 cups of dry dog food. Video included.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Not only is this bowl super cute.
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this bowl super cute.. it works!!! My 4 month old golden retriever/great pyrenees puppy would inhale her food. She would eat roughly 2 cups of kibble in about 5 seconds. I tried only giving her small amounts at a time but it never stopped her from inhaling it. Which always resulted in her throwing it up whole. She wouldn't even chew it. Now with this new bowl it forces her to slow down to get her food in between the grooves. We love it!! It's taken her about 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: PUG owners: This dish may work for breeds with ...
customer_reviews.text: PUG owners: This dish may work for breeds with longer snouts, but I have a pug and no matter how hard she tried, she could not get the kibble out at all. She even snapped at our other dog because of her frustration. If I can find the same dog dish, but not as deep, I would definitely buy it! Please help our brachiocephalic breeds!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must Have !
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing bowl for food hogs like mine, I was worried initially since she is brachycephalic and would'nt finish her food, reached out to Kyjen (excellent customer service). As directed, after two days of leaving food there and sure enough she was trying much harder, now it takes her about 20 minutes to eat 1 cup of kibble (as opposed to 20 seconds) I get some time away and she seems to enjoy it. Added benefits: lower risk of bloat, better stools and .. believe it or not, less flatulence! fully recommended
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Works great but peels after a few months of use
customer_reviews.text: Love the bowl, but it has a downside. It worked great at getting my Scottish terriers to eat slower since it made it more difficult for them to swallow their food in just a couple bites. Downside is the bowl has started peeling after being used for only a few months. I would rate it a 5 if it hadn't peeled.
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: Pointless
customer_reviews.text: Got the bowl for my dog yesterday. I was able to use it to feed him his dinner & breakfast this morning & that was it. He broke a chunk out of it. I suppose it’s technically still usable, but seeing as how it’s a jagged chunk that was knocked out of it, I’m not using it again. Complete waste of money. And my dog doesn’t usually destroy stuff either.
customer_reviews.author: K. Compton

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my 8-10 lbs dogs
customer_reviews.text: I needed a dish to slow down my 8 lb chi-mix while she eats and at the same slow her down enough to keep her from stealing her sisters food when she finishes. I also wanted a dish that would stay in place while she eats. Well, this dish did the trick! It's a little big in circumference that I would prefer, but the notches work well to make my dog work harder to get each piece of kibble and as you can see in the video it stays put while she eats. She now is the last to finish, so no more supervision during meal time anymore which is so very nice to not worry about!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P. Covington

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for chunky wet food
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it works for patte but it doesn't work for chunky food. As you can see in the video she wasn't able to get anything out. Maybe one or two pieces. I had to scoop the food back out. And she can only get wet or homemade food for her cancer diet.
customer_reviews.author: DiMarco Family

customer_reviews.title: Nope, not for this little Boston!
customer_reviews.text: Well, apparently I have a 1%er dog, I read the negative reviews and most of them were about dogs tipping over the bowl, only a couple that their dog couldn't get the food out. With the small teal bowl, my dog couldn't get the kibble out. The poor guy loves food and he just gave up because he was too frustrated. I tried to help him out, but since the particular food he's on doesn't stick to the tongue, he couldn't get the bottom layer out of the grooves and just shoved them around and around with the tip of his tongue in a circle over and over. On to something else!
customer_reviews.author: Evy J

customer_reviews.title: love this bowl so much
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh this bowl is the best thing ever! My poor dog was a major gulper, she would eat her in probably under a minute. I think she was rushing to go try to bully the other dogs away from their bowl. She's a hungry girl. Anyway... she would get SO GASSY. Like poisonous gas, I thought we might not wake up in the morning. And super bloated. Internet said try a slow bowl. Thank goodness for the Internet, am I right? This slows her down so much the other dogs are finished before her. That had never happened before. They aren't bullied, she isn't bloated and we don't worry about getting gassed in our sleep. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Irritated Cats Happy Humans
customer_reviews.text: At first the cats were not amused. They stalked me through the house, yowling. Oh the poor whiners. They'd been wolfing down their food previously and that always lead to random puking through the day. Everything else we'd tried had failed. So we bit the bullet and got two of these. It took time and while they still whine they're at least eating slowly and the only thing they are horking up lately are hairballs. They've been making more of a mess, sending kibble everywhere but it's a fair trade. This has definitely been a worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.author: C Duecy

customer_reviews.title: Yes, I found the answer!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our chiweenie who would literally inhale her food in 7 seconds flat. Now it takes her long enough to eat her food as it does our larger dog who gets a third of a cup more than she does. It's actually rather comical because she ends up walking around in circles around it trying to get the food out. But now she shouldn't end up with a disorder from eating to fast. It runs thru the dishwasher well, even with heat dry on the bottom rack. And it doesn't slide around all over the place when she eats either.
customer_reviews.author: W. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: The bowl is a good size for her (we got the smaller of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the pink flower looking slow feeder bowl for my Corgi. It usually takes her a few seconds to eat, she inhales her food without chewing. Not only is that unhealthy, it caused stress for us and our other dog because she would run to the other dog's bowl to try to steal their food. This bowl has completely changed our routine and slowed her down. It now takes her about five minutes to eat her meal. The bowl is a good size for her (we got the smaller of the two sizes), and it has a rubbery bottom so it doesn't slide much or tip over.
customer_reviews.author: TenaTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Good bowl to slow eating.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the smaller bowl and it is great for my very large dog. This significantly slows the rate of my dog's eating. The small bowl will hold 2 cups of food and the large bowl holds a lot of food- I recommend this, especially the smaller size if your dog gets smaller meals throughout the day. The small size works fine even for my 100lb dog.
customer_reviews.author: FlowerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Slowed our labs eating RIGHT down!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our black lab puppy (3 months old). This dog has an insane appetite, he would eat so fast he would choke and I started to get scared that he may actually choke to death. This bowl completely solved the problem, what used to take 1-3 minutes to eat now easily takes 4-5 minutes. He ever chokes, and has to work quite a bit to get the food out. Best part- he seems to enjoy it! People say cleaning it is hard, it’s not really if you let it soak a few minutes it warm water with dawn dish soap, then with a small sponge, clean it out, rinse well, air dry, good for a few more days.
customer_reviews.author: Technologic80

customer_reviews.title: This is a great bowl.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy, and is very useful feeding bowl in slowing a dog eating their food. It has a very durable smooth surface which is difficult to put fingers in to rinse out so a thin sponge to access the thin grooves. The grooves are such that it forces dogs to stick their tongues deep into the bowl to get a few pieces of kibble at a time. It will hold approximately two cups of food. Using these bowls for my dogs has helped their digestive issues soI am totally sold on using these bowls now. I use these inside so I don’t know how they would stand up to sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Making my pups quarantine!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been bored to tears over the past few weeks! Living in the city I really counted on daycare, parks, and training classes to keep my dog stimulated. Now all of those things are closed. Kong’s weren’t doing it, and I still have to work so I needed something to fun for my dog to do. This fun feeder bowl keeps my dog occupied for about 30 minutes, since she has to get every scrap of food out. This bowl has made a huge difference in my dogs life, she loves it. I will likely buy the other 2 colors as well.
customer_reviews.author: emcquillan

customer_reviews.title: Really slowed down Harry's eating
customer_reviews.text: Harry would inhale his food in less than 2 minutes. After I read about the hazards of this and learned about this bowl from a friend I got one in December. Harry now finishes his dinner at the same time as my other dog. It takes him some time to get into all the grooves. He doesn't seem to be annoyed with the bowl, it just takes him longer to eat. It does take marginally more time for me when dishing out the dog food as I have to "spread" the food around the bowl unlike when using a conventional dog bowl. Easy to clean. And looks like new after a month of use.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lue

customer_reviews.title: From 30 seconds flat to 23 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Our almost 4 month old Golden Retriever could devour 1 cup of food within 30 seconds. It got to the point where he would gasp for air and it sounded like he was choking. Decided to pick up this slow feeder and the difference is night and day. We timed him the first time and it took him 23 minutes to eat the same 1 cup of food. No issues with inhaling and choking on food, and it thoroughly tired him out ta boot! Great investment, and until he slows down, we'll continue to use this bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Southern FamilyTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is intended to do
customer_reviews.text: My one year old dog was scarfing his dinner and then throwing up so his breeder recommended this type of bowl. It has done what it was intended to do which was to slow down his eating and no more getting sick after meals. Two challenges we face -- it does not fit in his raised bowl feeder and feeding him with bowl on the ground defeats part of the purpose and two we also feed raw in addition to kibble so I now put the raw inside a rubber kong and freeze it. he gets after dinner as a treat. So not a perfect solution but better than we had.
customer_reviews.author: you get what you pay for

customer_reviews.title: Good slow feeder
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my cat originally. It's too deep for him to get his whiskers in so he just sits and stares at it. Not wanting to just toss it, I tried it out w/ the dog. It is great w/ him. In the past, he would grab like 4-5 kibbles and bring them out onto the living room carpet and make a mess. With the slow feeder he now eats at his bowl which is really nice. It's sturdy and a good size. Would buy again if I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Schim

customer_reviews.title: Best dog food dish EVER!👏
customer_reviews.text: This dog-food-dish is THE ABSOLUTE #1 💯BEST thing that’s happened for my ELEVEN YEAR YOUNG POMERANIAN, BootsieBear’s digestion, etc. For eleven years, he has gulped his food...no chewing whatsoever...kibble, wet food, whatever, within 1-2 MINUTES. After the 1st day using this ‘blessing dish’ my Bootsie is now taking about TEN minutes to eat his breakfast kibble, & later his dinner wet mixed with kibble. IAm overjoyed!!! For over a week (since rec’g the dish) my sweet boy has NOT VOMITED AT ALL. OF COURSE, I SURE RECOMMEND getting this miracle-working dog dish to any dog lover! ( I got the purple flower dish) And, my BOOTSIEBEAR says: BIG WOOF WOOF THANKYOU to OutwardHound👍
customer_reviews.author: Connie H.

customer_reviews.title: Pup Figured It Out But Still Slowed Him Down
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for slowing my little guy (21 lb, 6 month old Shiba Inu) down while he’s eating. He had no problem figuring it out. He doesn’t have any food aggression problems, but he does get car sick and I noticed when he threw up in the car, his food came back up completely un-chewed. That’s why I got this. Hoping the slowing down will make him chew and aid in his digestion. Even if it doesn’t, it does slow him down and if that’s your intention for buying this, you can buy with confidence (unless your pup knows to tip it over to get all the food out, then there’s not much you can do 🤷🏻‍♀️).
customer_reviews.author: AshleyMac

customer_reviews.title: Puppy torture
customer_reviews.text: This product is well-made and is as described a way to slow down your dog from eating. I’m giving it a rating of one simply because It makes eating much too difficult for the dog and makes the eating process frustrating and unpleasant. I purchased the medium mini turquoise drop For my eight week old 10 pound Pudelpointer. It was so difficult for him to eat from he gave up after three minutes. Meal time should be a pleasure for the puppy. He does scarf down his food rapidly but that doesn’t seem to cause him any problems and I don’t see the benefit of torturing him with this technique. I will be returning it
customer_reviews.author: Reno shopper

customer_reviews.title: YOU WON’T BE DISAPPOINTED!!
customer_reviews.text: This is BY FAR MY FAVORITE slow feed bowl! I have another one from this same company but THIS one is my favorite!! I wish this exact pattern and size came in different colors!! With this one when I sprinkle the food in, it doesn’t bounce out everywhere. It works and takes my dogs so much longer to eat their food. Usually twice a week I collect all 3 bowls and soak them in semi hot soapy water for about 20 min then wash them and set them to dry on my drying mat. I literally can’t say enough about this one!! Except make this exact one in different colors!!!
customer_reviews.author: amanda lynn champagne

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 American Bullys, Both have been using the bowl. I must say I have seen improvement. I was concerned they wouldn't use the bowls but both actually enjoy the bowls and I like how light weight but sturdy the bowls are. They are easy to clean and stay in place. You cant beat the price and value. I really wish I would known about these sooner. I definitely recommend them and think they are a great prouduct.
customer_reviews.author: kdb

customer_reviews.title: Chow Hound
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 dogs. 2 who eat their meals with perfect manners, and one who Hoovers it up and then stands, vulture like, over the other 2 until they finish. This bowl has actually done as advertised! Not only does Hoover now finish his meal at about the same time as his siblings, but he actually seems to be enjoying hontin down the last few morsels hidden in the maze. His tail shoots up and starts flagging like he has spotted an African Gazelle freshly brought down for his enjoyment. The bowl is also a much sturdier construction than I imagined and does stay put while he dines. Overall, an excellent investment.
customer_reviews.author: Notypst

customer_reviews.title: Great slow feeder bowl, definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: So we don't actually don't have fast eaters, but my 2 year old border collie likes to push all her kibbles out of her bowl to get to the (evidently much tastier) kibbles at the bottom. It was a pain to constantly pick up uneaten food off the floor. She can no longer make a mess with this bowl! I was a little concerned that our older dog wouldn't take to the new slow feeder, but there have been no issues, and he can easily get the kibbles out. I also like that this bowl is sturdy, doesn't slide across the floor at all, and I can just pop it in the top rack of the dishwasher to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Karah127

customer_reviews.title: Slows feeding time down as promised
customer_reviews.text: This actually works to slow our resident food-inhaler down--currently, 45 pounds and 5 months lab/hound mix--so that it now takes her a few full minutes to eat a meal (previously, about 30 seconds). I did first try the stainless steel kind with a "moat" around a center protrusion, but that didn't slow her at all. The drawback to this is it's less easy to clean, and on some more enthusiastic dining occasions she's been able to leave teeth marks. We've only had it for a couple months so I expect we'll need to buy a new one or different version in another couple months, but overall this works well and I'm glad to have tried it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Collins

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t say 10x slower Bob,
customer_reviews.text: But it really did slow down his eating. A big improvement for sure. He would clean his normal bowl in less than a minute. It now takes him several minutes longer to eat. It has a low profile and is wide which has made it uninteresting for him to flip around the house when hungry. Haven’t tried cleaning it outside when it was delivered but was not difficult. Also, can’t say if food will stick to it for two reasons, the plastic is such that it looks to be made of a very non-porous material and two, my pup licks every Bart of that bowl clean.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We noticed our dog was very gassy and burped a lot after eating (he is a Springer Spaniel). A friend whose dog uses one of these bowls raved about it. We decided to try it out for the price to see if it slowed him down and stopped the excessive burping/farting. He has only used it for 3 days, but I love how it has forced him to slow down in his eating. He was quite puzzled at first and now it's an entertaining challenge! Great buy! Excessive burping and farting have also lessened in the past few days! We bought the purple flower design, regular size bowl. Our Springer is small for his breed at about 35lb.
customer_reviews.author: allison

customer_reviews.title: Great concept
customer_reviews.text: I like the indicated bowl since it completely slowed down my rescue cats eating. The depth and circumference appear to be just the right size form y cats. The dish is a bit time consuming to clean, but that is to be expected and is worth the trouble. The only negative is the plastic is easy to chew up. My cats regularly gnaw on the ridges to get the food. Consequently, this behavior has let the bowl having teeth marks covering the circumference. After six months of use, I had to replace it with new bowls. I did try a ceramic slow feed dish, but the product did not work as well as the indicated item.
customer_reviews.author: JULES

customer_reviews.title: Slowed the gulping way down!
customer_reviews.text: One thing we've found with the rescue dogs that have come to live with us ... they gulp down food. I tried to just have this dog, Honey, eat a little, then I'd take the food away from her mouth and have her eat a little more, etc. All that accomplished was her taking bigger mouthfuls each time. I thought she would be freaked out and upset by these bowls but no ... she was intrigued and has gone from eating her food in under five minutes to taking about 10 minutes to pick it all out. She is a large chihuahua, about five years old. They don't move, they are easy to clean and she likes them. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: TXEggplant

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars! It works!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 50lb rescue dog who would literally swallow and gulp down her food in a matter of seconds without chewing, then proceed to throw it all up a few minutes later. We thought it was her food, so we switched foods many times before giving her tinier portions, then eventually coming across this style bowl, and deciding to give it a try. It’s been about two months and no puking. Our dog now calmly eats her food one or two kibbles at a time, chewing in between bites. We’re very happy that she has learned to slow down to eat. And I’m especially happy I don’t have to clean up doggy throw up daily.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Mynxxie

customer_reviews.title: It takes twice as long and makes her think while eating
customer_reviews.text: My wild husky mx doesn't chew she inhalers her food. Didn't know what to expect with this bowl. Well, it's a life saver. It stopped her from inhaling food . It made her think of how to pick her kibble out. It works with wet food as well. It takes her twice as long to eat it now. IThis bowl is great. I highly recommend getting this if your dog inhales food. If they don't inhale food it will make them think. That's always a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Spam Yee

customer_reviews.title: Great slow-feeder for greedy dogs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my big dumb Labrador because he woofs down his food WAY too fast. This bowl slows him down, which is good because I don't want him to get indigestion or choke. And I also don't want my other dog to feel rushed to woof down his food, for fear of the Labrador stealing his. Update: after just a few months of feeding him from this bowl, I ended up going back to his normal metal bowl. Now he naturally eats a lot slower, even out of normal bowls. He takes a while to eat now, and he even loses focus on his food and gets distracted with other things.
customer_reviews.author: Ashes

customer_reviews.title: Tried to use it to slow feed my cats
customer_reviews.text: My cats have been vomiting from eating their kibble too fast so I looked to get a bowl that would encourage slow eating. They all mostly seem to be for dogs so I settled on getting this one to try on my cats. It seems to work and help them eat a bit slower, but the cats aren’t even able to reach the kibble once it gets low enough. Although it claims to hold quite a bit of kibble, most of it would be pretty hard to reach. I guess for dogs they may be able to reach with their tongues, but I just want to highlight how deep the bowl is.
customer_reviews.author: Shannomnom

customer_reviews.title: Slows her down so she can enjoy dinner longer!
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought this orange swirl medium/mini. It's bigger than I expected, but perfect size for my 20 pound beagle/pom mix. She LOVES food, and was gulping dinner in 25 seconds. But NOW, with this bowl, she enjoys her dinner for a full 5 minutes. YAY!! We have always challenged her with toys and puzzles and I think she understands this is a fun way to make dinner last longer, so it is more enjoyable for her. It is super easy to clean. She's had three dinners from it so far and I have watched to be sure there wasn't any problem - so far, it's been great!
customer_reviews.author: TZ2DSR

customer_reviews.title: Great bowl!
customer_reviews.text: My Texas Heeler is a medium size dog, and she vacuums up her food in seconds. She gets 2/3 c. of kibble twice a day. I agonized over which bowl would be best for her, and I finally decided on the medium/mini orange swirl. It is nice and deep which made her have to work for the food like an anteater. It took her several minutes, and another thing I like was that she actually would stop to get a breath and even got a little exercise having to move around. When she was through, she lay there with the bowl like she was satisfied. I laughed and did a little happy dance. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: kbw

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these for more than 5 years now and it's still working great. My girls just get so excited at feeding time they would actually cough and choke on their food trying to hork it down so quickly. I just bought one for my other pup who was starting to gobble down her food too quickly too. These bowls are pretty solid and don't slide around the floor which is awesome. The colors are vibrant and haven't faded or stained at all. I alternate between hand washing and throwing these in the dish washer and haven't had problems. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Really slowed my puppy down!
customer_reviews.text: My pitty-x puppy was inhaling her food from a regular bowl and then would go dive into out other dogs's bowls. The first night I fed her with this, it took a full 10 minutes! She's gotten the time down a bit, but she will never be able to eat out of this bowl faster than the other dogs eat out of their's, allowing them some peace at meal time! She was frustrated at first, but now that she's gotten the hang of it, she just goes after it. As far as cleaning, I just spray it with kitchen cleaner (non-toxic!) or dish soap and then fill it with waterlet it soak a bit, then rinse and let air dry.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Koss

customer_reviews.title: It slows her eating!!
customer_reviews.text: This bowl is a little obnoxious to look at BUT, it does what I need it too! My one year old 70 pound Lab eats her food like she hasn't eaten in a week! Well, this did the trick she wasn't too sure about the bowl, just looked at it but within 5 minutes decided she wasn't getting her old bowl back. It took her at least twice as long or longer to eat her food. I'm very happy with my purchase :-)
customer_reviews.author: MsMasters

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my rescue puppy. She came here gobbling her food and as an experienced dog owner, I know this is dangerous. I picked this bowl because it was pretty and it matched my kitchen. It works perfectly. In less than two days she has gone from gobbling her food to picking at it throughout the day. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Cubascaramel

customer_reviews.title: This is a useful & fun product
customer_reviews.text: My little rescue dog eats her food so fast that it’s all gone in 5 seconds. This bowl slows her down to about 4-4 minutes — a huge difference. I usually pack the food in as tight as possible to slow her down to the max. I even use it when she gets snacks. I cut up an apples and wedge the pieces in tight so it’s like a puzzle for her to solve. Last time i I did this, she dragged her bowl across the kitchen and brought it into her doggy bed. It’s fun to see how much she likes it. (see photo) LOL! If this review is useful please click the helpful option to give me feedback.
customer_reviews.author: My2wins

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Well, I LOVE it! My 8 mo old pup was gozzling down food lately. So I ordered this and it arrived today. I used the bowl for his dinner (since I work from home during COVID, I continued to give 3 meals since he give me the begging eye though he is 8 mo old now...) He ate most of the food 2 hours ago and now after he played in a kiddy pool, zoomies and catching a ball... now he is trying to scavenge left over dog foods in the bowl rather than giving me the begging look. Now it will be his nigh night time soon...... still about 10 pieces left in the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Winner!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely slowed down my 85lbs hound dog's gobbling. Dinnertime now takes 20-30 minutes instead of 2. I feed my dogs homemade food and I squish the food down in there, they have a project to get all the food. It's also great to smear some peanut butter in there, busy pups. I bought a few different styles to change it up from time to time. Cleaning is easy for me because the dogs don't leave anything in there. I've run this through the dishwasher as well as hand washed, it's quite easy. I think if they did leave leftovers, I'd get a bottle brush for the nooks and crannies though.
customer_reviews.author: Mega Meggerz

customer_reviews.title: The best yet convenient way of slowing a dogs eating.
customer_reviews.text: Dogs that eat too fast or gulp their food can get bloat which is deadly. This is the best yet convenient way of feeding them that I have found. Convenient in that you just pour their food over the feeder. No opening or unscrewing parts to put the food in. We also use these at a professional K9 Service dog training center I work at. We feed 50+ dogs twice daily and a few of the dogs use these as their food dish. It works well! I personally use it when I bring puppies home that I raise for the service dog program. It trains them to eat properly.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart K.

customer_reviews.title: These work
customer_reviews.text: I have three rescue beagles - all are a little food insecure. Their past pattern was to inhale their bowl of food and then start circling the other bowls. Lots of high drama associated with feeding. I got these bowls and SHAZZAM! Works like a charm, the dogs are so intent on getting the good out of the nooks and crannies, they forget the other dogs. Perfect! And better for their digestive health. Only criticism: the bowls are very light weight and hence my 4 star rating instead of five. I don’t know how long they will last, but as far as taking the feeding frenzy, these bowls are the best.
customer_reviews.author: JoeLouis

customer_reviews.title: Great mental stimulation, slows eating and makes her love her feeding time.
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old German Shepherd Dog needs mental stimulation and fun. This does both, plus slowing down her eating. She gets very excited when I feed her using these. She avoids her regular dish which is full, and runs to where I place this dish. I learned they do this for zoo animals - give them more of a challenge to “find” and “work for” their food. She enjoys the digging more than the food, I think. I bought all three, and use a different one for each meal. I place them in different places around the room, too. She gets to be a “real dog”, in her mind. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend these sturdy bowls!
customer_reviews.text: Love these food bowls for my two pit bull puppies! They typically eat like maniacs so switching to these have slowed their eating down considerably. I mix salmon oil into their food and they clean up easily. These sturdy bowls hold up well to some serious wear and tear with these boys! We got the larger size first when we had only one puppy but it was almost too big so we got two smaller ones when we got puppy number two and they are perfect! They hold 2 cups and we only feed them about 1 1/2 cups at a time. Highly recommend if your dog eats aggressively!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Alan Schminke

customer_reviews.title: It has slowed her down...
customer_reviews.text: Our 1 year old black lab would down her food and not even take a breath then would have a stomach ache because of it. I've heard good things about slow feeder bowls in the past so I decided to try. I got this one based on the reviews and it has done wonders for our puppy. It has slowed her down by at least 15 minutes! I'm ecstatic about this purchase based on that alone! The bowl is well made and pretty easy to clean as well. I think this bowl is fantastic for those who has a dog that is a rocket eater.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Braunscheidel

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my pug
customer_reviews.text: I have two pugs who both inhale their food. This bowl worked for my male pug, who is larger and apparently has a longer tongue! My smaller pug had a very difficult time getting the food out of the grooves. I gave her about a week to figure it out but she continued to be frustrated with it. I'd have to tip it over and let the food out eventually for her to finish eating. It was a bit heartbreaking to see her struggle, so I ended up ordering a stainless slow feeder instead. That works like a charm. These bowls are made very well--but be sure your dog has a long enough tongue to use it!
customer_reviews.author: LulusMom15

customer_reviews.title: Makes them eat slower and more peacefully.
customer_reviews.text: Bowl works perfect. Takes them several minutes to eat what normally would take 10 seconds. In this video they each got 1 scrambled egg and a 1/3 cup ground meat. The blue bowl is always faster. The orange bowl take much longer, particularly with very wet food. They eat less and seems to like it more.
customer_reviews.author: QuackQuackQuack

customer_reviews.title: Great for my pig dog =D
customer_reviews.text: My girl (80lbs, shepherd mix) loves to eat and was constantly choking on her food. This bowl slowed her from eating almost 3 cups of food in about a minute to eating the same amount in about 6-7 minutes. It has stopped her choking and indigestion. I mix wet and dry food together but she still is able to get everything out of the bowl. I clean it right after she’s done and so far, nothing sticks to it (not that my big piggy leaves anything behind). The rubber grips on the bottom keep it from sliding all over the place while she eats. I definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: S. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Gave my dog acne/sores on chin
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my 11 year old lab eats her food way too quickly, sometimes causing stomach upset. This bowl fixed the problem - we bought it in teal and orange, and preferred the teal color for our dog. However, we noticed that she'd break out on her chin and would develop small sores that would bleed. Our vet said it was due to the plastic bowl breeding bacteria, and it requires more frequent sterilization than our old stainless steel bowl. I switched back to her old bowl and the sores went away. Also, the top of the bowl started peeling slightly after several months. So, sadly we stopped using these once and for all.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the walls could be shorter or the channels wider?
customer_reviews.text: My large breed puppy can't get his nose or tongue in there far enough to get all the food. He gets very frustrated and tries to flip the bowl. I ended up getting the larger bowl at the same time I purchased this one, but still have the same problem with the walls being too high. He's a 4 mo old goldendoodle. I do still use it now and then for fun but I have to dump the bottom half of his food into his regular bowl in order for him to finish eating. He isn't a particularly fast eater so slow feeding isn't really necessary for him, I like that he gets brain stimulation from this.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: The BEST Bowl Ever!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I own a Shih Tzu that would INHALE her kibble in 20 seconds or less. I purchased this little green bowl and it is the perfect size for my dog and now takes her about 4 minutes to eat 1/3 of a cup at each meal. The photo shows the 1/3 cup of kibble and I tried to push it all too one side so you could see there is more room in the bowl if needed. The zig-zag trenches are perfect for her tiny tongue to get the pieces out. It slows her down but does not frustrate her. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie R

customer_reviews.title: Great product for dogs who don’t chew their food
customer_reviews.text: This product is a life saver. My dog eats really fast and then he throws up his food. You can tell he just doesn’t chew it and then it upsets his stomach. Of this kept happening I decided to purchase this bowl to hopefully solve this problem. He adjusted to it very well and knows how to use it like a pro. He actually takes his time when eating because it has to figure out how to get his food out. It is also a puzzle which is really good for his brain and his mind. It also actually helps with bloat because his stomach does not get any bigger after he eats his food.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Slows down the dogs that eat too fast, orange one cracked.
customer_reviews.text: They work great to slow down my large dogs that seem like they inhale their food. I got the purple and orange bowls originally then had to buy the blue one. I was originally looking for elevated feeders, so I planned on building a platform for them, but I found that if I turn a 5 gallon bucket upside down that the bowls fit perfectly on top. My female Doberman gets the purple one and works great slowing her down. The only issue I had is that my pit bull crunched down on the orange one and it cracked a hole on the raised part in the middle of the bowl so he has the blue one now without issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Renay

customer_reviews.title: Phe-NOM-enal
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy plastic, plenty of room, and absolutely slows the ol boy down. Our puppy would MOW his food. This slows things down nicely so that he can enjoy the flavors and the way his food tickles his palate. He seems to actually enjoy eating out of it as it keeps his mind busy too. Doesn’t slip around much considering the ravenous beast attacking kibble, and is quite easy to clean. If your dog is a food vacuum...Don’t think twice. One thing I will note is that this sellers way of describing the sizes of the bowl is the only thing you won’t like.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Household harmony is restored
customer_reviews.text: One of our dogs eats at the speed of light. She doesn't actually even eat her food is more like she vacuums it up. And after she finishes her food she goes after the food of the other dogs, causing sadness and/or growling. We solved this problem by purchasing this feeding dish and feeding her separately in another room. Our little Hoover (not her real name but that's what we call her because of the way she vacuumes up her food) now finishes her food at about the same time the other dogs finish eating. All is peaceful...
customer_reviews.author: Ride to the Music

customer_reviews.title: Best I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 9 months ago for my Belgian Malinois puppy AKA Belgian Maul it all. While she chews anything you give her and destroys 95% of her toys this bowl has lasted. I feed her in her crate so she does have time to destroy it like she did her previous bowl. Because of it’s design she cannot get a grip on it. She did remove the four nubs at the base but the bowl is still stable. It holds the 2 1/4 cups of food I feed her per setting and as increased her eating time from 1 minute to 5-7 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: MadPage

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I have a one year old Queensland Heeler that acts like she is starving all the time! She inhales her food and will often go after the other dogs' food so I have to stand guard to make sure she doesn't. This has solved that problem. I've only used it a few times so far as we just got it but it has slowed her down tremendously. I expected her to get frustrated and dive for another food bowl but I think the hunt for kernels has her intrigued. My other very slow eater is finishing his food before she is done. I'm so glad I got this!
customer_reviews.author: 1972F350

customer_reviews.title: It does what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: My ding dong dog inhales his food in about 15 seconds. He never chews it. You would think he never gets fed on a regular basis. But he is. He gets a little chubby if he eats too much (he is 80 lbs.). The vet recommended he eat slower. So I told him to chew his food. He ignored me. So I got him this bowl. It takes him a couple of minutes to eat now. So I guess that is better. He does chew more...I wish it was super deep so his tongue had to b-a-r-e-l-y reach the food. This is not a bowl for a tiny dog. Maybe I need one designed for an ant-eater...lol.
customer_reviews.author: cabmansgal

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job - slows down my fast-eating dog
customer_reviews.text: Before this my dog would scarf down his food in about 30 seconds, and you'd hear him burping and occasionally gagging, although he never threw up because he's got an iron stomach. But i figured it would be better / healthier to slow him down a bit. with this thing, he takes a couple minutes to eat, and I don't hear any of the negative side effects. It's bigger than I expected and thick heavy plastic that leads me to believe it is sturdy and I'll own this for a long time. Plenty of room for the food of my 80 lb lab/shepherd mix.
customer_reviews.author: B. D.

customer_reviews.title: EVERYTHING WE’VE BEEN SEARCHING FOR!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING!!!! My 10lb dog always scarfs his food and chokes himself and we’ve tried everything to get him to slow down. Toys in the bowl, trying to train him to take breaks and sit halfway through eating, broth, raw food, feeding him separate from our other dog and nothing works! We’ve though about slow feeder bowls but it’s so hard to find one small enough for him that it’ll actually serve it’s purpose. This is exactly what he needed and now we don’t have to constantly hover over him to make sure he doesn’t choke while he eats. It’s absolutely perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Hinkle

customer_reviews.title: the house smells better
customer_reviews.text: My dog was a food wolfer, and was gaining weight since she finished first and could grab the other dogs little bit left in their bowl. But what really lead me to get this bowl was how bloated and gassy she was for some time after eating. I am so relieved! And I know she is too. I designated a sponge for the dog bowl making it quick and easy to clean in the curves. She did try to trade bowls with the other dog so she could keep up her fast eating habit, which I thought was funny. They finish about the same time now, and the other one is a very slow eater.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: perfect for slowing down chow time
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed to slow my dog while he is eating. I wanted him to take longer since it felt like he was inhaling his food and jot eating it all. since getting this, he takes his time and actually has to work to get his food. My pup chews on everything and this had with stood him and he has only been able to chew a small part on the bottom and could barely get at it. It can be in his kennel for hours and still not be destroyed until other plastic feeding bowls that I have used. I choose this design to really slow him down and it worked! holds max 2 cups of food
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: I love these dog bowls!
customer_reviews.text: I have three large dogs and they used to scarff down their food and spill it all over the kitchen floor. I love these dog bowls I bought three, one for each dog and it has been great!!! I love that they are dishwasher safe, so they are easy to clean. Now my dogs have to think about what they are doing while eating and they don't spill food everywhere, and because the one the resource guards has to eat really slowly she can't resource guard the other food bowls anymore. I would recommend these for sure!
customer_reviews.author: CCF

customer_reviews.title: Works amazingly well!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works amazingly well. My lab was a very fast eater and I was worried that it would cause issues with her stomach from eating so fast. A friend recommend that I look into a slow eating bowl for her and I decided to give this one a try and had no expectations of it slowing her down a bit. I was completely wrong. She want from eating her cup of food in about 30 sec to about 2 to 3 minutes. It worked so well that a friend decided to buy a couple of them for one of her friends who has two dogs with the same fast eating problem.
customer_reviews.author: Anthonyi

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, poor execution
customer_reviews.text: It definitely works as a slow feeder, I just dont understand the rubber tabs at the base of the bowl. Maybe they're to try to help the bowl grip the floor, but my dog chewed them up. A really unnecessary, and thoughtless feature when you're giving a dog a food puzzle. It's not the easiest to clean, but it's worth it since my dog is entertained for at least an hour and not shoveling his food down. I wouldnt leave a heavy chewer unattended with this, my dog tried to chew all ends of this in an attempt to get the frozen food in it. The concept is great, just poor execution.
customer_reviews.author: christopher r.

customer_reviews.title: Completely WORTH purchasing!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a blessing, I have 2 pups that inhale a cup of food twice a day and do t even taste it. I was worried the med/small purple flower bowl was going to be too small, however it was actually perfect sized for my 40lb AmStaff I also ordered the lg/med orange swirl bowl for my 65lb AmStaff and it is actually too big for the amount of food he eats twice a day, however it is a good thing because he pushes it around and has to think and search.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda A

customer_reviews.title: Helps slow down speed eaters
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a lab-pit mix who previously would scarf food down from a standard bowl in 45 seconds. With a slow feeder bowl from Top Paw (Petsmart Brand) that slowed to 1 min. With this slow feeder bowl she eats closer to 2 min for drier foods and 3-5min if I sprinkle some of her favorite foods/flavors on top and dilute with a broth. Any slow feeder bowl will a touch longer to clean the crevices than a standard bowl but it's worth the price if your dog eats so fast you think they might choke on a kibble without the obstacles. Love the different patterns Outward Hound makes for their slow feeder bowls.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer P

customer_reviews.title: Slows down speed eaters
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are speed eaters, especially my 2 dachshunds. They’d eat so fast they’d choke on their food! I bought the purple, orange & teal bowls to try out and they’ve definitely helped slow down how quickly my pups eat. They weren’t even phased they had new bowls! They seem sturdy and despite how rough my dogs eat, the bowls don’t move too much. I haven’t tried washing them yet but like that they’re dishwasher safe according to the package so they should wash easy! Overall, very happy I purchased these.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Add a weight to the bottom to make it perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Turned a 30 second feeding time into thirty minutes. At first they circled the bowls, my two cats howling in disgust. Took them a couple days to learn how to get all the food out. They like them now and eating is a game for them plus they don't get sick from eating anymore. I did have to double side Velcro 2 pound flat circular dumbbell weights on them as they quickly learned to just flip the bowel over, problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an overeating pitbull pup
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY PERFECT! Our newest pitbull puppy was an overeater to say the very least. I purchased this product because he'd place his face into the bowl and inhale his food. This lead to an overly large stomach and grunting noises when he'd eat. I received this product 2 days ago and I am quite impressed with everything about it. It's very affordable and durable. My pitbull puppy can no longer simply scarf his food down, swallowing it whole. This bowl forces him to use his tongue and then he actually is chewing his food before he's going back for another bite. I am so happy!!
customer_reviews.author: ambers.amw

customer_reviews.title: Good configuration, seems to slow down my dog who wolf's his food.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second slow feeder dog dish I've purchased for my Golden Retriever. He very quickly figured out how to get around the curves in the first one. The configuration on this one seems to be more intricate and so far slows him down quite a bit more....time will tell. I can't speak to the durability, but is seems solid and well made.
customer_reviews.author: goldendoglover

customer_reviews.title: Great slow feeder, exactly what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this bowl after purchasing a smaller slow feeder for our pitbull puppy who was scarfing down his food. This maze bowl slowed him down and made it challenging to get all the food out. It holds about 2-3 cups of food depending on the size of the food you use. Easy to clean, and non slip on my kitchen floor. The little rubber grippers keep them from moving the bowl all over the place. We liked it so much that we purchased another one in the same size with a different maze in case he gets too good at this one so we can switch it up. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Not for cats - unless they have anteater tongues
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my cats since others claimed to have success. My guess is they would starve to death if this was the only option. One of my cats eats with her paws all the time and had great difficulty eating out of this bowl. When I say 'great difficulty' I mean next to impossible. The other cat could not get her face anywhere near the food and she's very small - almost kitten sized. These bowls would be great for dogs, but not for cats. The are good quality - just didn't work for us.
customer_reviews.author: Shiva

customer_reviews.title: Will slow your quick eater down substantially
customer_reviews.text: My large 80lb black lab/great dane mix used to go through his 2+ cups of food in less than a minute. He would occasionally throw up his food. Ordered this hoping to slow him down and does it ever. Now it takes him probably about 5 minutes to get every last piece. Haven't had him throw up since then. I wish he'd chew his food more but even eating in smaller bites it seems as if he's still trying to inhale it. Not much I can do about that.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: This bowl works!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter's lab puppy eats like hell on wheels. I had bought him a different one first (wasn't impressed), and he ended up destroying it while his parents were out shopping and didn't kennel him. While my daughter didnt like the color, this one works. He used to get done so fast he was staring down their other much smaller dog (who eats as slow as Christmas), for 5 minutes. With this bowl Bentley gets done eating and Finn is still trying to get his out of this bowl!
customer_reviews.author: Aneve M

customer_reviews.title: No more Guard Duty!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! It is true! It literally took my two Cheagles (1/2 Chihuahua-1/2 Beagle) 10 times longer to eat their meals. Longer. We went from 45 seconds to 9 MINUTES! Now I can read the paper and relinquish my post between feeding stations - I have an old Boston Terrier who eats slow and was always under threat of marauding Cheagles - so I stood guard duty for him. Additionally, I honestly believe it has reduced the Cheagles's anxiety at meal time too. They are concentrating on getting all their food from the maze v. planning a Boston ambush.
customer_reviews.author: Michele McCloskey

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ordered one of these for my male chihuahua who is eating his food like a crazy dog in two seconds and starts bothering his sister, trying to take her food. After about two days, he slowed down with his food and everything went to the opposite, my female chihuahua finished her food first and wanted to take the male’s food from the slow feeding bowl so I’ve ordered another one of the same bowl. The package of the bowl says “10 times slower eating” that is totally true! Finally there is peace in the apartment. The two dogs finishing eating in the same time. Very satisfied with these bowls.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Toth

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Here's the story. We have a Boxer Pit... he needed one to slow down and actually eat his food. He normally inhales it, and runs around with his bowl. We have Lab Rottweiler... he needed to slow down. We have another Pit (the white dog)... she didn't need a bowl. But after we gave the boxer/pit and the rotten lab she pouted.... and if you know pits they stick their bottom lip out and pout. So my white pattie got a purple one just so she wasnt left out.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Literal life saver
customer_reviews.text: We have an older, large barrel chested dog. As she’s gotten older, she has begun to wheeze after she eats. This is the second bowl that I have purchased. The first one I purchased was too small and moved around the floor. This one is perfect size and the rubber grips on the bottom do not allow the bowl to move while she feeds. She is a 64 pound English setter mix. This is perfect. She does not wheeze after she eats ANYMORE ( knock on Wood) and we will continue to use it for years. THIS has been amazing at preventing bloat in our girl.
customer_reviews.author: MrsGreek

customer_reviews.title: It's not as slow as I'd like
customer_reviews.text: This feeder if filled with a 1/2 cup of food will slow down your dog. If it's filled with over a cup of food or more it's not very slow. It also has to be put in the dishwasher "just so" in order to get the back to not fill up with water. The purple flower small on is the product under review here. It works okay and is sturdy but don't trust the fill volume listed-- while it will technically hold that amount of food it does not slow down that volume of food-I should have gotten a larger one in order to slow down the eating more effectively.
customer_reviews.author: pet person

customer_reviews.title: If you’re on the fence, just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This food bowl has been a god send. If you’re on the fence, just do it! My dog used to eat so fast and inhale his food, never chewing a single morsel of his kibble which resulted in him vomiting up his meals about three times a week. Now he eats much slower and actually chews every piece. I think it’s fun for him because he gets to search for every little bite and it’s like a game for him. He hasn’t thrown up ONCE in the two weeks we’ve used this bowl. It’s a great invention and I’m really grateful!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Adams

customer_reviews.title: Too deep for brachycephalic dogs
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Boston Terrier who would eat so fast and then throw up. I specifically got this model because I heard from others that this was still good for the short-snout breeds. While it definitely slows down his eating and he's not vomiting as much, it's still too deep for him to get all the food. It's not the biggest deal, but now I have to assess his bowl more closely to see if he needs a refill and also not let the old food sit in the bottom too long.
customer_reviews.author: Karbear

customer_reviews.title: Really works for the greedy food gulper
customer_reviews.text: My dog can literally eat her entire bowl in about four bites. Takes her seconds to eat her meal. It was scary to watch as I know the sometimes severe consequence and resulting surgery that can come along with that doggy behavior. This bowl slowed her waaaay down. It almost makes me giggle to watch her try to bolt her food with this food dish. She is much safer now! I wash my dog bowls after each feed. A good spray an it is on its way to pretty clean. I use a bottle brush to get between the tracks so it is a little harder to keep clean but worth it for the health of my silly dog.🤣
customer_reviews.author: Skymom

customer_reviews.title: a must-have item for your dog's health
customer_reviews.text: Very good for my dog's health! We are fostering a 3rd dog and he eats very fast. Well, they all eat too fast. One day he ate way too fast because I made the mistake of feeding the dogs too close together and he (the fostered dog) must have felt threatened. After seeing his stomach bloat up very badly followed by diarrhea infused with some blood all over my house including small pieces of stomach liner...we took the dog to the vet and I bought these bowls. The dogs eat much, (much!) slower now and seem to enjoy the challenge of getting the food out of the grooves. This is a must-have item for any dog owner in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Said goodbye to fast food. . .
customer_reviews.text: Our vet recommended we get our puppy a slow-feeding bowl. She would finish her meals in about 30 seconds flat. This bowl definitely makes her take her time. She actually seems to enjoy the challenge to get every last piece out of her bowl. I will admit the longer she has the bowl the less time it takes her to finish - she's figuring it out. The bowl is substantial and does not slide around while she eats. We are very happy with this bowl and think she is too.
customer_reviews.author: Helena Basket

customer_reviews.title: You've GOT to get this for Your Dog!
customer_reviews.text: I Love, Love, LOVE this doggie feeder bowl! My dog and pretty much every dog I've ever owned eats their food so quickly and then they suffer from upset stomachs. This bowl with It's unique design practically "forces" my dog to take his time. I have also squirted a bit of the KONG food gel you get in a can in there or a bit of peanut butter between feeding, and it occupies my dog for 30 minutes or so. He seems to have less stomach issues now and that makes me a happy momma!
customer_reviews.author: Rita Karaffa

customer_reviews.title: Great for snub nose breeds
customer_reviews.text: I got this bowl to slow my French Bulldogs eating. It definitely works! He has to take his time eating now, it keeps him occupied longer and it's nice and low profile for his short snout. I would highly recommend this bowl for short nosed breeds. He gets 3/4 cup of a larger kibble and still has plenty of room for more. He's less "gassy" LOL and seems more satisfied with his meals. If you want to slow your eater, this is the bowl for you! I would suggest one of the other bowls for a longer nosed breed. This is a well made product, sturdy, good weight, won't tip over and dishwasher safe!
customer_reviews.author: M. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Slows Eating Down By A Lot
customer_reviews.text: We have another Outward Hound slow feeder bowl as well. We got this to provide variety, so he doesn't master one and start gulping his food. This bowl slows him down way more than the other one. That said, I don't use this one in the morning due to time constraints. It takes a good 10-15 minutes for him to clear this bowl vs. the 3-5 minutes it takes for his other one. So, I use one for breakfast and this one for dinner. They're really sturdy and don't slide all over the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Much longer meal times!
customer_reviews.text: I got this bowl for my puppy when he was about 2.5 months old. He would eat his meal in about 30 seconds. He gets just over 2/3 of a cup of dry food each meal. This feeder slowed him down a lot. I got him the spiral one so he will go in circles around the food bowl to get all of the pieces. At first it would take him 10 minutes or more. Now it only takes about 5 minutes, but that is awesome when compared to 30 seconds. I do recommend trying this bowl and I do plan on buying other patterns for him for mental stimulation at meal time.
customer_reviews.author: Kagurarisa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my voracious miniature schnauzer
customer_reviews.text: I really needed to slow down my miniature schnauzer Apollo's 20-second inhalation of his meals. While our elder schnauzer, Cicero, leisurely dines on his food, Apollo's is usually gone as soon as I put down his dish. He loves games that involve hunting for treats, so I knew this was the perfect solution to engage him in 'play' while also slowing his pace of food consumption to more like 2-3 minutes. Success! Very pleased with this slow feeder. Easily washable, sturdy, doesn't slide around. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Roni Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Not what we were hoping for
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my over exited dog because he devoured his food in 2sec. But the plate ended up being a bad idea, he had no patience and ended up levaing food on the plate, which got full of ants bugs later. Worst part it that sometimes he got his nose injured for trying to reach the kibble.
customer_reviews.author: selcouch

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: My golden retriever puppy is a extremely food motivated. We have been using those "puzzle balls" which she loves, but they are noisy on our hard wood floors and when they get trapped under our sofa, my pup barks like crazy. I needed a quiet food puzzle for her early morning feedings (before the family wakes up). This food puzzle isn't as "fun" as the balls, but it slows her down so that she does not inhaled her food. I bought this "slightly used" on Amazon and it was a fantastic find! Great price and a great product! My pups loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Outward Hound Fun Feeder Slo Bowl - Slow Feeder Dog Bowl
product_meta.description:
Size:Large/Regular| Style:Turquoise DropWhy do dogs feel like eating has to be a race? We have no idea, but we solved the problem anyway. Featuring meal-lengthening ridges and mazes, Fun Feeders keep pups engaged for up to 10x longer at chow time, which improves digestion while helping furry friends eat at a fun, healthy pace! 

Available in 3 unique colors and designs, the Fun Feeder also features a slip-resistant base to prevent sliding and food spillage. Fun Feeders are top rack dishwasher safe, BPA, PVC & phthalate free, and available in mini (2 cups) and regular (4 cups) sizes. 

Go beyond the bowl!
feature_bullets: PROMOTES FUN HEALTHY EATING - Fun Feeder Slo-Bowls help dogs eat up to 10X slower
IMPROVES DIGESTION - These dog bowls naturally improve digestion by allowing dogs to forage for their food through the fun patterns and mazes
VETERINARIAN RECOMMENDED -Vets recommend Fun Feeder Slo-Bowls to aid in digestion and help prevent bloat. Made with high-quality, food-safe ABS plastic
NON SLIP BASE & FOOD SAFE MATERIALS - Fun Feeder Slo-Bowls won't slip or slide & are made with food-safe materials that are BPA, PVC & Phthalate free
PROPER PORTIONS- The Large Fun Feeder Slo-Bowl holds up to 4 cups of dry kibble, the Small holds 2 cups & the X-Small holds 3/4 cup. All Fun Feeders work great for dry or wet food diets
